articles.title: Exclusive: Sexist FTSE bosses using 'pitiful and patronising' excuses to keep women out of the boardroom, Government review finds
articles.description: Sexist bosses at Britain's leading firms are using “pitiful and patronising” excuses to keep women out of the boardroom, a major Government-backed review has found.

articles.title: Brussels' kamikaze tactics to keep the EU dream alive will end in tears
articles.description: No, you can’t leave the EU, you can’t quit the euro and you can’t even have a little less Europe.

articles.title: ‘Embarrassing’ leak shows  EU falls short of own data law
articles.description: The European Commission has claimed that it is not subject to the strict new data protection law that it has imposed across Europe, following an “embarrassing” leak of personal data on its website.

articles.title: Divorce, bankruptcy and broom cupboards: the very public turmoil of Boris Becker
articles.description: Boris Becker has spent the last 30 years living up to his nickname.

articles.title: 'The Devil's aspirin': Ambien, Roseanne, and Hollywood's sleeping pill nightmare
articles.description: When even the most successful comedy on US television can be toppled by a single tweet, it’s important to establish how it made its way online in the first place.

articles.title: An outsider’s guide to the UK
articles.description: Watch the video to find out more about some of the best parts of the United Kingdom – through the eyes of a selection of international visitors.

articles.title: Theresa May warned by Europe's biggest businesses that time is 'running out' over Brexit
articles.description: Theresa May has been warned by some of Europe's biggest businesses that "time is running out" and that a free trade deal after Brexit must be as "frictionless as with a customs union".

articles.title: The truth about low-carb diets
articles.description: "No carbs before Marbs" is the dieting mantra of a legion of reality television 'stars' – but it now seems that the theory behind the low-carb diet, which exploded in popularity at the turn of the century, isn't as catchy as once thought.

articles.title: 'Murdered' Russian journalist Arkady Babchenko turns up alive after staged assassination
articles.description: An anti-Kremlin journalist reportedly killed in Kiev on Tuesday is alive, it has emerged.

articles.title: Sir Michael Morpurgo reveals his secret cancer battle
articles.description: Sir Michael Morpurgo, the English author, poet and playwright, has revealed he has been having treatment for cancer and said his grandchildren give him "hope" of combating the disease.
